body.name: Perlegear UL-Listed Full Motion TV Wall Mount for 42–90 Inch TVs up to 150 lbs, Pre-Assembled TV Mount with Tool-Free Tilt, Swivel, Extension, Max VESA 600 x 400mm, 12″/16″/18″/24″ Wood Studs, PGLF16
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 16 hrs 7 mins
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 16 hrs 7 mins
features: Upgraded High-Strength Steel: This Perlegear heavy duty wall mount TV bracket boasts enhanced strength by 50% for unparalleled stability, making it an ideal choice for ultra-large TVs that weigh up to 150 lbs.

Wide Compatibility: Our TV wall mount can be mounted on 12″ to 24″ wood stud walls, solid concrete, or brick with the included mounting hardware. The swivel TV wall mount supports screens 42″–90″ in size with VESA patterns ranging from 200x100 to 600x400mm.

Maximum Flexibility: The full motion TV mount features +/-65° swivel to easily direct the screen toward your position. Extend your TV 22″ from the wall for viewing or retract it back to 2.89″ to save space. The tilt knob makes it easy to adjust the screen +5° to -15° without tools to reduce glare.

Easier Installation: This 85 inch TV wall mount ships with a preassembled front support to reduce installation steps by 30%. A handy drilling template is included to make wall installation simple and to ensure precise mount placement. Clearly labeled parts help to streamline the process and avoid parts confusion.

U.S.-Based Support: Whether you have questions about mounting or need help choosing a product, our dedicated customer service team is available to assist. Trust us to make your articulating TV mount experience as smooth and hassle-free as possible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install and very sturdy. Holds my 65” tv easily and provides multiple adjustments for optimal viewing angles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I had a unique application where I decided while building my entertainment center I wanted to wall-mount the TV versus have it on a shelf. I needed about 18” of extension to accomplish this, and I was hesitant as I didn’t feel a 65” TV could be extended that far without considerable sag.This mount is rock solid. Very easy to mount to studs in your wall. I like how the TV easily hooks onto the mount, and that you can secure the screen with a bottom screw on each side.The screen can easily be adjusted left and right, either by sliding in the mount, or simply by the nature of how the hinge mechanism works. It’s simple to extend and move the screen once mounted, and it holds its position very well.I’m glad I went this route.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very well built wall mount
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant to purchase this mount as it was a bit higher in price than other mounts I was considering. I got it on a sale for $89 and I have to say it was money well spent. Hung a 77” Samsung S89C with this and I wanted to make sure I bought a mount I could trust. Mount is very well built with no pre assembly to the mount itself. Templates provided and instructions were easy to follow. Only minor complaint is the included hardware didn’t have the M8 x 30 mm length I needed for this TV. The included hardware had a gap of 25mm to 35mm which both were too short or too long. I had to run to the hardware store to get the 30mm length I needed. Maybe this is just a thing with these new Samsung TVs but wanted to point that out. Overall I would highly recommend this mount.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy install, sturdy well-made.
reviews.reviewText: This wall mount was very easy to install, and it arrives in the box almost fully assembled. I've tried other mounts and returned them because they were not well made or difficult to install. My 77" OLED TV is securely mounted and can be swiveled from side to side.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Range Of Motion
reviews.reviewText: The full motion mounts makes connections easy and quick. My previous mount titled and the tv needed to be removed for most connections. I have a Samsung 75” QLed Neo TV hanging from the mount and it is sturdy and secure.I have a home that was built in the 60’s. I had to drill holes in my previous mount to align with two studs. I love how versatile this mount is. The range of motion is incredible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wall mount for large TV
reviews.reviewText: This is another type Perlegear Tv mount I have purchased and use they are very well made, work well and very good price I recommend again and have purchased several types. One recommendation would be too start trying to use same rails for each mount where possible

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Feel comfortable using it for 85" Television
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy and supports 85" TV well, Easy to install. Adjustments to level TV are easy to use. Comes with a level which is nice. Adjustment to tilt TV forward easy to use and straight forward. Excellent installation instructions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy well made
reviews.reviewText: I've never hung a television as large and heavy as this one. We're all kind of flipping out. Took three of us. That was just a put the television. Up high enough. To set it on the mount. It says it weighed 99.9 lbs. Out-of-the-box. Very important. To find center on your mount and your television and do the math from ceiling. To what you're hanging it over? I lost 9 inches because of a beam. I had a new fireplace mantle and a new TV. And I had to trust all the manufacturer measurements. But when I went to hang it, I gave myself a couple extra inches off the ceiling and I'm glad I did. Because you don't think about it. But the TV doesn't go straight. On to the mount. When you have no clearance, I had to tip it. Hook it and then let it set on the bar. But as you can see, it worked out well. I would definitely use this product again. I just don't know if I ever own another television this large again. I was mounting this into a brick wall. So I definitely did not want to have to keep redrilling holes because I was off by an inch. I wished I could have found a wooden stud. But no such thing in a brick wall. Lead anchors and lag bolts. So what I used? I would not recommend using. Permanent hammer in anchors. Because you don't know if your math is right. Good luck.
